abstract.p: The Tranasaction Aggregator component can transform transaction data into Datashop formatted transaction or student-step rollup data.

The required fields for input data are: 'Anon Student Id', 'Time', 'Problem Name', and 'Step Name'. And either "Problem Start Time" or "Problem View" field is also required to be present. Any other field that is not present in Datashop transaction data will not be included in final output. For Example, KC model should appear in column with header such as "KC (model name)".

There are currently two types of output: transaction and student-step rollup. For transaction output, four columns are computed or re-computed: 'Duration (sec)', 'Is Last Attempt', 'Attempt At Step' and 'Outcome'. For student-step rollup, output fields are as same as those in Datashop student-step rollup. Field such as "Opportunity (model name)" is particularly useful for analysis components such as Linear Modeling, AFM, and etc. The student-step level aggregation is problem view based, meaning different problem views for the same problem and step will be aggregated into different student-step rows. If problem view is not present, aggregation algorithm will use problem start time to compute problem view, meaning data with the same problem start time for the same problem and step are assigned with the same problem view, and thus are aggregated into one student-step row. If you are not sure what problem view to use, leave problem view column out and let the component compute probelm views for you. Datashop help

Special note: when aggregating transaction to student-step rollup, if your input transaction file contains an "Event Type" column, only "instruct" and "assess_instruct" values would trigger increment of opportunity count by 1 in student-step rollup file.
